title: Ticket #6862: scitokens: admin cannot define hostname:port of credmon webserver
description:
Currently, if an admin wants to run the credmon webserver, condor assumes it to be running at the root of the webserver, which is accessed at the FQDN under port 443 (i.e. https://<fqdn_of_submit_host>/). The admin should be able to modify this in case the webserver is running on a different port or if the webserver is hosted under a subdirectory (e.g. https://mydomain.edu:8443/credmon_app/).

Currently, there is an undocumented knob, ZKMHOST, that can do this, but we should make it more obvious. See lines 294-304 in /src/condor_credd/credd.cpp . Maybe we can call it CREDMON_WEBSERVER_HOST, which will default to the FQDN if unspecified.
remarks:
2019-Jan-16 20:32:57 by bbockelm:
Two cents:

  1. It's not a hostname, it's a URL prefix.
  2. We should be able to specify just a path prefix if the hostname auto-detection works. This will allow easier packaging of the credmon, where the packagers may know the prefix of the webapp but not the hostname it's deployed on.
  3. Does the credmon know its URL? Is there any way it can pass this information along to the credd without a sysadmin knob?

In terms of bikeshedding -- CREDMON_WEB_PREFIX ?

2019-Jan-17 08:40:20 by jpatton:
Agree on (1) and (2). It's not apparent to me how to do (3). Flask is agnostic to where its home is unless the admin sets app.config['SERVER_NAME'] .

CREDMON_WEB_PREFIX is ok with me. Might either need to clarify that https:// is not needed or we should have code to strip out whatever protocol (if any) is put by the admin and replace it with https:// (to be sure that users' browsers are checking for secure HTTP).

2019-Jan-17 09:46:27 by bbockelm:
Yes - let's require the string start with https:// and send an error back otherwise.

  • In submit.cpp, I hope the param name "UseOAuthServies" should really be "UseOAuthServices".
